wikipedia_page.main: David Shedden (24 May 1944 in Kilwinning – 27 October 2017 in Linwood) was a Scotland international rugby union footballer, who played on the wing. He died in October 2017 aged 73.

response: :"Never the quickest of wingers, Steele's gritty defensive qualities and combative nature combined perfectly with some of the more attacking Scottish internationals of his day, particularly Andy Irvine and David Shedden."

response: Winger David Shedden, who played for Old Spierians in the 1960s, won 15 caps for Scotland while playing for West of Scotland.

link_mentions.page: List of Scotland national rugby union players
response: |778||SheddenDavid Shedden||style="text-align:center; background:#A0D1F9;"|wing||1972-12-16||v New Zealand at Murrayfield

In the 1960s, David Shedden and Alec Wilson were now the stars of the club. Both moved on to West of Scotland. Shedden was later capped by Scotland; Wilson, although named as a substitute for the Scotland team, never made it onto the pitch. However Wilson did make a Scotland 'B' cap.
